Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style, pottery dinos; interior: black band on edge of rim, unslipped below; exterior, white slip: double guilloche pattern on top of rim; at junction of rim and shoulder narrow band, above painted decoration consisting of sphinx to left (part of head with added red hair, curlicue and part of wing remaining); part of group of vertical tongues and rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Mature Animal Style dinoi are few but they are frequently found in the earlier Wild Goat Style as well as in the contemporary Sphinx and Lion Style. Williams (2006a, 128) notes that Chian dinos sherds are often mistaken for oinochoai because of the lack of slip on the interior surface.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0036) (phase 2)
